title: Drawing, "Project for Ceiling Design: Aurora", 1810–25
medium: Pen and brown ink, brush and watercolor, black chalk on off-white laid paper
markings: Watermark: escutcheon with three lines of letters.
inscribed: Inscribed in pen and brown ink, lower margin, center: L'aurora. In graphite around perimeter of drawing on all sides, each one of the eight sections is numbered accordingly: 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 7, 8.
creditline: Museum purchase through gift of various donors
description: Circular composition.  Aurora flies toward right holding leaves above a basket which is carried by putti. One putto below pours water from a jar.  In the left background is Apollo rising in a chariot.  Framed by a square in graphite, the lines being divided into eight parts.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Project for Ceiling Design: Aurora", 1810–25.
1810–25. Pen and brown ink, brush and watercolor, black chalk on off-white laid paper. Museum purchase through gift of various donors. 1901-39-3213.
